page.title: 01The Welsh Hills
page.content: For the most part the general features of this area include large tracts of moorland, heath and grassland, with occasional patches of eciduous trees and granite outcrops. Many of the valley which permeate the site are steep river valleys, and although there are a few farms in the area, much of the land is uninhabited except for the many sheep that inevitably dominate the region. As a result, the land tends to be rather foreboding and expansive, cold and windswept. And yet, it has a rugged beauty that defier description, a freedom that needs to be felt rather than vertalised. It is truly a splendid place.
